HDG.LOG.content: a protection in which what lies before remains (bleibt) laid down: stored, laid away, secured & deposited in unconcealment (Unverborgenheit), sheltered in unconcealment > the keisthai of upokeimenon: presencing (Anwesen) of that which lies before us into unconcealment: legein concerns safety (Geborgenheit), safekeeping, gathering appropriate to such a laying [what about annihilation?], safety of that which comes together into presence (des beisammen-Anwesenden)

motif.name: UNSCATHED / SAFE / SACRED / GUARD / SECURITY / KEEP
motif.title: UNSCATHED / SAFE / SACRED / GUARD / SECURITY / KEEP

motif.name: PREORGINARY SYNTHESIS [Derrida bringing together instead of dividing?]
motif.title: PREORGINARY SYNTHESIS [Derrida bringing together instead of dividing?]

HDG.LOG.linkedContent: a protection in which what lies before remains (bleibt) laid down: stored, laid away, secured & deposited in unconcealment (Unverborgenheit), sheltered in unconcealment > the keisthai of upokeimenon: presencing (Anwesen) of that which lies before us into unconcealment: legein concerns safety (Geborgenheit), safekeeping, gathering appropriate to such a laying [what about annihilation?], safety of that which comes together into presence (des beisammen-Anwesenden)

HDG.LOG.content: omologein as when fateful comes to pass, proper hearing [when does fateful not come to pass? Nietzsche, Derrida], the laying that gathering has sent (die lesende Lege geschickt hat): where, and as what, does the fateful presence?
HDG.LOG.linkedContent: omologein as when fateful comes to pass, proper hearing [when does fateful not come to pass? Nietzsche, Derrida], the laying that gathering has sent (die lesende Lege geschickt hat): where, and as what, does the fateful presence?

HDG.LOG.content: logos essentially occurs as en panta [wholeness] > [all uniting is the one, gathering, centrifugal] > logos, gathering everything (alles) in the totality (All) of simple presencing? > Der logos legt ins Anwesen vor und legt das Anwesende ins Anwesen nieder, d.h. zurück [heterotautology: laying back into presence what is present before] > presencing: having come forward to endure in unconcealment (hervorgekommen im Unverborgenen währen) [endure, linger awhile, totality]
HDG.LOG.linkedContent: logos essentially occurs as en panta [wholeness] > [all uniting is the one, gathering, centrifugal] > logos, gathering everything (alles) in the totality (All) of simple presencing? > Der logos legt ins Anwesen vor und legt das Anwesende ins Anwesen nieder, d.h. zurück [heterotautology: laying back into presence what is present before] > presencing: having come forward to endure in unconcealment (hervorgekommen im Unverborgenen währen) [endure, linger awhile, totality]

HDG.LOG.content: [lays what is present before into presence] > all disclosure releases (Entbergen enthebt) what is present from concealment [Lacan, return of repressed] > forgetting as a reservoir to draw from [aletheia, trace]
HDG.LOG.linkedContent: [lays what is present before into presence] > all disclosure releases (Entbergen enthebt) what is present from concealment [Lacan, return of repressed] > forgetting as a reservoir to draw from [aletheia, trace]

HDG.ID.content: man obviously (offenbar) is a being [presumption of beings], so he belongs to totality (Ganze) of Being, to be in the order (eingeordnet) of Being > man is unique: being who thinks, open to Being, face to face w/ Being, referred to being, answers to it > man is essentially this relationship (Bezug) of responding (Entsprechung) to Being, he is only this > this “only (nur)” is not a limitation (Beschränkung), is an excess (Übermass) [surplus] > man lets Being arrive as presence, such becoming present needs (braucht) openness of a clearing, and by this need (Brauchen) remains appropriated (übereignet) to human being [Being needs man]

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.ID.linkedContent: man obviously (offenbar) is a being [presumption of beings], so he belongs to totality (Ganze) of Being, to be in the order (eingeordnet) of Being > man is unique: being who thinks, open to Being, face to face w/ Being, referred to being, answers to it > man is essentially this relationship (Bezug) of responding (Entsprechung) to Being, he is only this > this “only (nur)” is not a limitation (Beschränkung), is an excess (Übermass) [surplus] > man lets Being arrive as presence, such becoming present needs (braucht) openness of a clearing, and by this need (Brauchen) remains appropriated (übereignet) to human being [Being needs man]

HDG.ID.content: presence, enter domain of belonging together, move is a leap (Satz) in the sense of a spring (Sprung) [Kierkegaard]

motif.name: PREORGINARY SYNTHESIS [Derrida bringing together instead of dividing?]
motif.title: PREORGINARY SYNTHESIS [Derrida bringing together instead of dividing?]

HDG.ID.linkedContent: presence, enter domain of belonging together, move is a leap (Satz) in the sense of a spring (Sprung) [Kierkegaard]

HDG.ID.content: the frame (Ge-stell) as a 2nd forgetting [?], prevents even Being of beings as presence > w/in Ge-stell must experience (erfahren) strange ownership/appropriation in which man & Being are delivered over to each other, must enter into Ereignis (event of appropriation), the word Ereignis [“the words” in English translation] should speak as a key term in service of thinking [via dissemination, Derrida deconstructs “key”] > Ereignis as singulare tantum, happens only in singular, not in any number, uniquely (einzig)

HDG.IM.content: Being of beings: self-restraining hold [St. Paul] that comes from a limit, holding the limit w/in [Being as erect, standing-there, presence, phallocentric] > for something to de-limit itself: take a stand, attain its limit [telos?: “end,” not negative, means coming to fulfillment (Vollendung)] [death is coming to fulfillment?] > limit/end: whereby beings first begin to be > what was done to “entelechy” (cf. Leibniz) & biology: decline from what is Greek

motif.name: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE
motif.title: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE

HDG.IM.linkedContent: Being of beings: self-restraining hold [St. Paul] that comes from a limit, holding the limit w/in [Being as erect, standing-there, presence, phallocentric] > for something to de-limit itself: take a stand, attain its limit [telos?: “end,” not negative, means coming to fulfillment (Vollendung)] [death is coming to fulfillment?] > limit/end: whereby beings first begin to be > what was done to “entelechy” (cf. Leibniz) & biology: decline from what is Greek

HDG.IM.content: parousia = An-wesen > for Greeks, “Being” fundamentally means presence, Greeks never returned to ground of Being, remained in foreground of what comes to presence
HDG.IM.linkedContent: parousia = An-wesen > for Greeks, “Being” fundamentally means presence, Greeks never returned to ground of Being, remained in foreground of what comes to presence

HDG.IM.content: Being as phusis, emergent self-upraising, self-unfolding that abides w/in itself, this sway as overwhelming [surplus, excess] coming-to-presence yet to be surmounted in thinking [what about Nietzsche?], that which comes to presence essentially unfolds as beings
HDG.IM.linkedContent: Being as phusis, emergent self-upraising, self-unfolding that abides w/in itself, this sway as overwhelming [surplus, excess] coming-to-presence yet to be surmounted in thinking [what about Nietzsche?], that which comes to presence essentially unfolds as beings

HDG.IM.content: war & rank > polemos and logos are the same: polemos as joint, gathering > polemos, struggle [Kampf], preserves in constancy, allows for arising & standing-forth; poets sustain struggle, open world, let beings come to presence [Being needs man]

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.IM.linkedContent: war & rank > polemos and logos are the same: polemos as joint, gathering > polemos, struggle [Kampf], preserves in constancy, allows for arising & standing-forth; poets sustain struggle, open world, let beings come to presence [Being needs man]

HDG.IM.content: Being has the meaning we have indicated [?], a definiteness that has long ruled our Dasein [?]: boundary drawn around sense of“Being” stays w/in sphere of “presentness and presence (Gegenwärtigkeit und Anwesenheit), substance and substance (Bestehen und Bestand), staying and coming forth” [?] [facticity of presence?] > our understanding of “to be” drawn to this horizon, and thus fulfilled
HDG.IM.linkedContent: Being has the meaning we have indicated [?], a definiteness that has long ruled our Dasein [?]: boundary drawn around sense of“Being” stays w/in sphere of “presentness and presence (Gegenwärtigkeit und Anwesenheit), substance and substance (Bestehen und Bestand), staying and coming forth” [?] [facticity of presence?] > our understanding of “to be” drawn to this horizon, and thus fulfilled

HDG.BC.content: [indifference point not dialectical sublation] Hegel could never say “Actuality” and nothing are the same, though he does realize both are most extreme abstractions of “actuality” > attend to the following only in passing [?]: Nothing presences, not the nullity people apply to it > when Nothing rests on fancy, mere play of understanding, the emptiest & the unique [just like Being] > Nothing not a nullity (for us): horror towards devastation, recoiling in terror of annihilation: shrinking back from something that can’t be addressed as mere imagination or something baseless
HDG.BC.linkedContent: [indifference point not dialectical sublation] Hegel could never say “Actuality” and nothing are the same, though he does realize both are most extreme abstractions of “actuality” > attend to the following only in passing [?]: Nothing presences, not the nullity people apply to it > when Nothing rests on fancy, mere play of understanding, the emptiest & the unique [just like Being] > Nothing not a nullity (for us): horror towards devastation, recoiling in terror of annihilation: shrinking back from something that can’t be addressed as mere imagination or something baseless

HDG.BC.content: inception has been, but not something past [inheritance], still presences, but concealed in its incipience [trace], perhaps inception of Being closer to us than everything we know, imperishable (Unvergängliche) [indestructible] > remembrance of inception not concerned w/ beings [how so???], but w/ what has been, i.e. what still presences
HDG.BC.linkedContent: inception has been, but not something past [inheritance], still presences, but concealed in its incipience [trace], perhaps inception of Being closer to us than everything we know, imperishable (Unvergängliche) [indestructible] > remembrance of inception not concerned w/ beings [how so???], but w/ what has been, i.e. what still presences

HDG.QB.content: essence of human being, “Dasein in human being,” is nothing human [the trace, totally other] > when the idea of human essence grounds everything present (i.e. human authoritative, underlying ground): secures beings in their being, (human essence is the presence that first) permits “representation”

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.QB.linkedContent: essence of human being, “Dasein in human being,” is nothing human [the trace, totally other] > when the idea of human essence grounds everything present (i.e. human authoritative, underlying ground): secures beings in their being, (human essence is the presence that first) permits “representation”

HDG.QB.content: from early period of Greek civilization to recent period of our century, “being” has meant: presencing (Anwesen) [not for you?] > every presence (Praesenz) stems from Ereignis of presence (Anwesenheit) [which way to read this genitive?]
HDG.QB.linkedContent: from early period of Greek civilization to recent period of our century, “being” has meant: presencing (Anwesen) [not for you?] > every presence (Praesenz) stems from Ereignis of presence (Anwesenheit) [which way to read this genitive?]

HDG.QB.content: [responding to Jünger on whether one doesn’t need certain concepts—only comprehension of an actuality] our concern not only w/ concepts of science but w/ fundamental words like Gestalt, domination (Herrschaft), representation (Repräsentation), power, will, value, security (Sicherheit), presence (Praesenz) (presencing [Anwesen]), nothing > fundamental words (Grundworten) of thinking are an other kind than metaphysical concepts > in latter: that which concepts (Begriffen) grasp (begreifen) same as this very grasping (Begreifen) [strange phrasing on the difference btwn forgetting fundamental words and using them unexamined]

motif.name: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY
motif.title: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY

motif.title: UNSCATHED / SAFE / SACRED / GUARD / SECURITY / KEEP

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.QB.linkedContent: [responding to Jünger on whether one doesn’t need certain concepts—only comprehension of an actuality] our concern not only w/ concepts of science but w/ fundamental words like Gestalt, domination (Herrschaft), representation (Repräsentation), power, will, value, security (Sicherheit), presence (Praesenz) (presencing [Anwesen]), nothing > fundamental words (Grundworten) of thinking are an other kind than metaphysical concepts > in latter: that which concepts (Begriffen) grasp (begreifen) same as this very grasping (Begreifen) [strange phrasing on the difference btwn forgetting fundamental words and using them unexamined]

HDG.QB.content: nothing, which as absence interrupts (Abbruch) (“nullifies [nichtet]”) presence, w/out ever annihilating it > insofar as nothing “nullifies,” it confirms itself as a distinctive presence, veiling itself as such presence
HDG.QB.linkedContent: nothing, which as absence interrupts (Abbruch) (“nullifies [nichtet]”) presence, w/out ever annihilating it > insofar as nothing “nullifies,” it confirms itself as a distinctive presence, veiling itself as such presence

HDG.QB.content: for Jünger, reduction characteristic of nihilistic trends; for Heidegger, reduction w/in Beings rests in a production of Being: unfolding of will to power into unconditional will to will [using destiny to affirm fuzzy assessments of an epoch] > the disappearance (Schwund) (absence) determined out of/through a presence (Praesenz), such presence precedes/surpasses all that disappears [nihilism & metaphysics as same destiny, Nietzsche]
HDG.QB.linkedContent: for Jünger, reduction characteristic of nihilistic trends; for Heidegger, reduction w/in Beings rests in a production of Being: unfolding of will to power into unconditional will to will [using destiny to affirm fuzzy assessments of an epoch] > the disappearance (Schwund) (absence) determined out of/through a presence (Praesenz), such presence precedes/surpasses all that disappears [nihilism & metaphysics as same destiny, Nietzsche]

HDG.QB.content: essence of nihilism is nothing nihilistic [a thought that palliates disagreeableness of thought of Verwindung of metaphysics] > Ge-stell when withdrawal of Being is represented nihilistically, that which presences as standing reserve (Bëstandigkeit) seems self-sufficient > X Being remains absent in strange way, maintains itself in a concealment that conceals itself [oblivion: a sheltering that preserves]
HDG.QB.linkedContent: essence of nihilism is nothing nihilistic [a thought that palliates disagreeableness of thought of Verwindung of metaphysics] > Ge-stell when withdrawal of Being is represented nihilistically, that which presences as standing reserve (Bëstandigkeit) seems self-sufficient > X Being remains absent in strange way, maintains itself in a concealment that conceals itself [oblivion: a sheltering that preserves]

HDG.QB.content: Dasein “held into (hineingehalten)” “this” nothing: humans hold free the site (Ort) for the totally other (ganz Anderen) than beings, so that w/in this openness something like coming to presence (An-Wesen) (Being) can be given > Der Mensch ist der Platzhalter des Nichts

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.QB.linkedContent: Dasein “held into (hineingehalten)” “this” nothing: humans hold free the site (Ort) for the totally other (ganz Anderen) than beings, so that w/in this openness something like coming to presence (An-Wesen) (Being) can be given > Der Mensch ist der Platzhalter des Nichts

HDG.QB.content: “attempt to cross the line” captivated in form of representation (in ein Vorstellen gebannt) belonging to dominion (Herrschaftsbereich) of oblivion of Being > subject to doubts, like every image > but these doubts (Zweifeln) can’t touch illuminative force of images, their originary/uncircumventable presence (ursprüngliche und unumgehbare Gegenwart)—shows how little experience we have in the saying of thinking (der Sage des Denkens), in essence of such saying
HDG.QB.linkedContent: “attempt to cross the line” captivated in form of representation (in ein Vorstellen gebannt) belonging to dominion (Herrschaftsbereich) of oblivion of Being > subject to doubts, like every image > but these doubts (Zweifeln) can’t touch illuminative force of images, their originary/uncircumventable presence (ursprüngliche und unumgehbare Gegenwart)—shows how little experience we have in the saying of thinking (der Sage des Denkens), in essence of such saying

HDG.FS.content: philosophy as an attempt at conjoining, Parmenides’ en, the being of beings, being not an empty word, exchangeable currency, always concretely apprehended as present (Gegenwart), as presence (Anwesenheit)—what is relation btwn presence/unity?

HDG.FS.linkedContent: philosophy as an attempt at conjoining, Parmenides’ en, the being of beings, being not an empty word, exchangeable currency, always concretely apprehended as present (Gegenwart), as presence (Anwesenheit)—what is relation btwn presence/unity?

HDG.FS.content: logos as gathering, “projects itself toward things that appear in their gathering” > for Greek thought, presencing of human is opening inception for oppositional presencing of World > alētheia: encounter (Begegnung) btwn that which presences and being is a self-opening, welcomes (Empfang) presence [a site, Ort?] > alētheia can’t be translated as truth

motif.name: TRANSLATION / BABEL in TB (BENJAMIN'S "TASK OF THE TRANSLATOR")
motif.title: TRANSLATION / BABEL in TB (BENJAMIN'S "TASK OF THE TRANSLATOR")

HDG.FS.linkedContent: logos as gathering, “projects itself toward things that appear in their gathering” > for Greek thought, presencing of human is opening inception for oppositional presencing of World > alētheia: encounter (Begegnung) btwn that which presences and being is a self-opening, welcomes (Empfang) presence [a site, Ort?] > alētheia can’t be translated as truth

HDG.FS.content: what sort of positing is that by which Absolute appears for consciousness? > in Greek, positing is thesis, apothēkē means same as apophansis, let matter stand here from itself, as it is, i.e. presences (anwest) > modern positing, however, is closest to Latin repraesentatio, the re- refers back to ego cogito, re- as “back to me,” thus that which stands becomes object (all this covered over by presumptions of idealism)
HDG.FS.linkedContent: what sort of positing is that by which Absolute appears for consciousness? > in Greek, positing is thesis, apothēkē means same as apophansis, let matter stand here from itself, as it is, i.e. presences (anwest) > modern positing, however, is closest to Latin repraesentatio, the re- refers back to ego cogito, re- as “back to me,” thus that which stands becomes object (all this covered over by presumptions of idealism)

HDG.FS.content: perception as aisthēsis [?] > “with the Greeks, and precisely in the distinction btwn aisthēsis and noēsis, hell has already begun” > in perception what presences is “bodily (leibhaftig)” [vs. positing, thesis, of representation], chair, flesh
HDG.FS.linkedContent: perception as aisthēsis [?] > “with the Greeks, and precisely in the distinction btwn aisthēsis and noēsis, hell has already begun” > in perception what presences is “bodily (leibhaftig)” [vs. positing, thesis, of representation], chair, flesh

HDG.FS.content: difficult to accomplish anew what Greeks did when they thought Being as an appearing outside concealment (phusis), still we ask: what occurs in fact of arising-into-alētheia? > the overabundance (Überfülle), the excess (Übermass) of what presences (Anwesende), thus why Thales can only look to the heavens, relation to this thrust of presence is thaumazein [wonder] [height & excess] > in extreme opposition, when astronauts landed on moon, moon as moon disappeared, only a calculable parameter (Rechnungsgrösse) for technological enterprise of humans
HDG.FS.linkedContent: difficult to accomplish anew what Greeks did when they thought Being as an appearing outside concealment (phusis), still we ask: what occurs in fact of arising-into-alētheia? > the overabundance (Überfülle), the excess (Übermass) of what presences (Anwesende), thus why Thales can only look to the heavens, relation to this thrust of presence is thaumazein [wonder] [height & excess] > in extreme opposition, when astronauts landed on moon, moon as moon disappeared, only a calculable parameter (Rechnungsgrösse) for technological enterprise of humans

HDG.FS.content: dimension of entirely excessive [totally other?] is that in which philosophy arises (entspringt), philosophy as answer (Antwort) of a humanity struck (betroffenen) by excess of presence, philosophy as a hyper-Greek way of ek-sisting

HDG.FS.linkedContent: dimension of entirely excessive [totally other?] is that in which philosophy arises (entspringt), philosophy as answer (Antwort) of a humanity struck (betroffenen) by excess of presence, philosophy as a hyper-Greek way of ek-sisting

HDG.FS.content: how does Platonic idea (eidos) correspond to what Greeks named presence, ousia, the most extreme excess? for Plato, to change, to alter oneself (sich ändern): abwesen (to absence)—idea as pure presence, never absencing, self-maintaining-making-present, presencing presence (anwesende Anwesenheit) as what’s there in excess, ontos on (Nietzsche had strong sense of this, Twilight of…)
HDG.FS.linkedContent: how does Platonic idea (eidos) correspond to what Greeks named presence, ousia, the most extreme excess? for Plato, to change, to alter oneself (sich ändern): abwesen (to absence)—idea as pure presence, never absencing, self-maintaining-making-present, presencing presence (anwesende Anwesenheit) as what’s there in excess, ontos on (Nietzsche had strong sense of this, Twilight of…)

HDG.FS.content: destruction, strong sense of de-struere, Ab-bauen (“dis-mantling”), not devastation (Verwüsten) > destruction strives to free original meaning of Being, this original meaning is presence (Anwesenheit), governs all Greek understanding of being (w/out its knowing it) [presence worthy of the name?]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: destruction, strong sense of de-struere, Ab-bauen (“dis-mantling”), not devastation (Verwüsten) > destruction strives to free original meaning of Being, this original meaning is presence (Anwesenheit), governs all Greek understanding of being (w/out its knowing it) [presence worthy of the name?]

HDG.FS.content: “Time and Being” thought “letting” as “giving (Geben)” > giving speaks in Es gibt (il y a too ontic of a translation, refers to presence of beings) > too ontic to understand Es Gibt as letting come to presence, as if it means “to make present” > rather think Es gibt re: letting itself, presence no longer emphasized: “to let the presencing (Lassen das Anwesen)” [still presence there?] (presence of a being no long draws one’s attention but ground the being covers over to stand independent) > letting as gift (Gabe), gives only its gift, withdraws/holds back (verbirgt)

motif.name: DERRIDA CONFESSES, SUMMARIZES in "Punctuations: the Time of a Thesis"
motif.title: DERRIDA CONFESSES, SUMMARIZES in "Punctuations: the Time of a Thesis"

motif.name: TRANSLATION / BABEL in TB (BENJAMIN'S "TASK OF THE TRANSLATOR")
motif.title: TRANSLATION / BABEL in TB (BENJAMIN'S "TASK OF THE TRANSLATOR")

HDG.FS.linkedContent: “Time and Being” thought “letting” as “giving (Geben)” > giving speaks in Es gibt (il y a too ontic of a translation, refers to presence of beings) > too ontic to understand Es Gibt as letting come to presence, as if it means “to make present” > rather think Es gibt re: letting itself, presence no longer emphasized: “to let the presencing (Lassen das Anwesen)” [still presence there?] (presence of a being no long draws one’s attention but ground the being covers over to stand independent) > letting as gift (Gabe), gives only its gift, withdraws/holds back (verbirgt)

HDG.FS.content: to unfold question of meaning of Being, Being must be given > Husserl succeeded in this making present of Being, phenomenally present in category > Husserl gave Heidegger ground: “being” no mere concept, no pure abstraction > Husserl doesn’t inquire forth into Being after reaching Being as given, doesn’t ask what it means > no question for Husserl, “being” means being-object (but objectivity is a mode of presence)
HDG.FS.linkedContent: to unfold question of meaning of Being, Being must be given > Husserl succeeded in this making present of Being, phenomenally present in category > Husserl gave Heidegger ground: “being” no mere concept, no pure abstraction > Husserl doesn’t inquire forth into Being after reaching Being as given, doesn’t ask what it means > no question for Husserl, “being” means being-object (but objectivity is a mode of presence)

HDG.FS.content: no “what stands against” in Greek, no Gegenstand, no “object,” only that which, from itself, presences
HDG.FS.linkedContent: no “what stands against” in Greek, no Gegenstand, no “object,” only that which, from itself, presences

HDG.FS.content: in Greek manner, einai means to presence (Greeks speak more revealingly (zeigender)/precisely than we do) [Heidegger’s bias?] > Parmenides’ esti gar einai, genuine tautology: names Same only once, as itself: [fragment 8] “the same dwelling in the same, it lies in itself” [cf. 80 verse is eukuklos, abundant/overflowing, says on its own complete tautology] > in domain of inapparent (Unscheinbaren): presencing itself presences (anwest Anwesen selbst): “great number of indications (Zeignisse) [marks? traces?]…”, indication as sēma, what shows & lets be seen
HDG.FS.linkedContent: in Greek manner, einai means to presence (Greeks speak more revealingly (zeigender)/precisely than we do) [Heidegger’s bias?] > Parmenides’ esti gar einai, genuine tautology: names Same only once, as itself: [fragment 8] “the same dwelling in the same, it lies in itself” [cf. 80 verse is eukuklos, abundant/overflowing, says on its own complete tautology] > in domain of inapparent (Unscheinbaren): presencing itself presences (anwest Anwesen selbst): “great number of indications (Zeignisse) [marks? traces?]…”, indication as sēma, what shows & lets be seen

HDG.MA.content: artist present in sounds of his music: master’s presence in the work, only true presence > greater the artist, more his person vanishes behind his work [MOP]
HDG.MA.linkedContent: artist present in sounds of his music: master’s presence in the work, only true presence > greater the artist, more his person vanishes behind his work [MOP]

HDG.DL.content: ambiguity of “Being,” not metaphysical representation, but the presence of Being, presence of the two-fold (Zwiefalt), Being and beings > if we heed (beachten) this [ambiguity of twofold], phrase never becomes catchword (Schlagwort)
HDG.DL.linkedContent: ambiguity of “Being,” not metaphysical representation, but the presence of Being, presence of the two-fold (Zwiefalt), Being and beings > if we heed (beachten) this [ambiguity of twofold], phrase never becomes catchword (Schlagwort)

HDG.DL.content: since Being and Time, bring out Being of beings (not in metaphysical manner [overcoming metaphysics]), so Being itself will shine out: the presence of present things (Anwesen des Anwesenden), two-fold of two in their simple oneness (Einfalt) > language: the prevailing (Vorwaltende) and bearing up (Tragende) in relation (Bezug) of human nature to two-fold > man realizes (west) [his nature] as man by corresponding (entspricht) to the call (Zuspruch) [promise?] of two-fold, bears witness (bekundet) to two-fold in its message (Botschaft)

motif.name: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE
motif.title: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.DL.linkedContent: since Being and Time, bring out Being of beings (not in metaphysical manner [overcoming metaphysics]), so Being itself will shine out: the presence of present things (Anwesen des Anwesenden), two-fold of two in their simple oneness (Einfalt) > language: the prevailing (Vorwaltende) and bearing up (Tragende) in relation (Bezug) of human nature to two-fold > man realizes (west) [his nature] as man by corresponding (entspricht) to the call (Zuspruch) [promise?] of two-fold, bears witness (bekundet) to two-fold in its message (Botschaft)

HDG.DL.content: language: fundamental trait (Grundzug) im hermeneutischen Bezug des Menschenwesens zur Zwiefalt von Anwesen und Anwesendem [in human nature’s relation to twofold of presence & present beings] > [we must] hear “Bezug” in this statement in a totally other way > not Bezug of demand (Brauchen) & supply (Beibringen) of commodities (Waren), man not a commodity > but man in his essence is in demand (gebraucht), this need claims him (beansprucht) > man is really man when “im Brauch (needed & used by…)” that which calls (ruft) him to preserve (verwahren) twofold

motif.name: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE
motif.title: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

motif.name: SOCIAL / COMMODITY / COMMERCE / MARKET see COMMUNITY
motif.title: SOCIAL / COMMODITY / COMMERCE / MARKET see COMMUNITY

HDG.DL.linkedContent: language: fundamental trait (Grundzug) im hermeneutischen Bezug des Menschenwesens zur Zwiefalt von Anwesen und Anwesendem [in human nature’s relation to twofold of presence & present beings] > [we must] hear “Bezug” in this statement in a totally other way > not Bezug of demand (Brauchen) & supply (Beibringen) of commodities (Waren), man not a commodity > but man in his essence is in demand (gebraucht), this need claims him (beansprucht) > man is really man when “im Brauch (needed & used by…)” that which calls (ruft) him to preserve (verwahren) twofold

HDG.DL.content: the call of two-fold can’t be explained by presence or present beings, nor in terms of their relation > only two-fold itself which unfolds (enfaltet) the clarity, the clearing (Lichtung), in which Anwesende als solches and Anwesen can be discerned (unterscheidbar) for man > no longer say relation to two-fold, not an object of mental representation, but: the sway of usage (das Walten des Brauches), which we never experience (erfahren) directly [!] [arrival?] if we think (vorstellen) two-fold as difference (Unterschied) visible in comparison that tries to hold Anwesende and Anwesen apart from each other

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.DL.linkedContent: the call of two-fold can’t be explained by presence or present beings, nor in terms of their relation > only two-fold itself which unfolds (enfaltet) the clarity, the clearing (Lichtung), in which Anwesende als solches and Anwesen can be discerned (unterscheidbar) for man > no longer say relation to two-fold, not an object of mental representation, but: the sway of usage (das Walten des Brauches), which we never experience (erfahren) directly [!] [arrival?] if we think (vorstellen) two-fold as difference (Unterschied) visible in comparison that tries to hold Anwesende and Anwesen apart from each other

HDG.DL.content: no answer will help us, must see (erblicken) appearance as reality (Wesen) of presence (Anwesen) in its essential origin (Wesensherkunft) [no refutation of Greek thought]
HDG.DL.linkedContent: no answer will help us, must see (erblicken) appearance as reality (Wesen) of presence (Anwesen) in its essential origin (Wesensherkunft) [no refutation of Greek thought]

HDG.DL.content: Iki: breath of stillness of luminous delight (Entzückens) > delight: what ensnares (Entziehen), carries away (Hinzücken)—into stillness > delight is the same kind as the hint that beckons on, to and fro (des Fort- und Hin- und Her-winkens) > hint is message of the veiling that opens up (lichtenden Verhüllens) > so all presence (Anwesen) has its source in grace (Anmut): pure delight of the calling stillness (rufenden Stille)

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.DL.linkedContent: Iki: breath of stillness of luminous delight (Entzückens) > delight: what ensnares (Entziehen), carries away (Hinzücken)—into stillness > delight is the same kind as the hint that beckons on, to and fro (des Fort- und Hin- und Her-winkens) > hint is message of the veiling that opens up (lichtenden Verhüllens) > so all presence (Anwesen) has its source in grace (Anmut): pure delight of the calling stillness (rufenden Stille)

HDG.WL.content: speaking must have speakers but not as cause/effect: speakers have their presence in speaking (im Sprechen ihr Anwesen)
HDG.WL.linkedContent: speaking must have speakers but not as cause/effect: speakers have their presence in speaking (im Sprechen ihr Anwesen)

HDG.WL.content: Sage: showing, pointing out, signaling (Jean Paul called phenomena of nature “spiritual pointer” or “spiritual index finger”) > Das Wesende der Sprach ist die Sage als die Zeige > in view of Gefüge der Sage, showing not exclusively/decisively property of human activity: Das Sichzeigen kennzeichnet als Erscheinen das An- und Abwesen des Anwesenden jeglicher Art und Stufe [presence still magnetizes presence/absence: self-showing marks the appearance of every kind/rank of presence/absence of all that is present] > even when man accomplishes showing, showing preceded by an indiction that it can be shown [beyond human] > must think of human saying like this to give adequate definition des Wesenden in all speaking

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

motif.name: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY
motif.title: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY

HDG.WL.linkedContent: Sage: showing, pointing out, signaling (Jean Paul called phenomena of nature “spiritual pointer” or “spiritual index finger”) > Das Wesende der Sprach ist die Sage als die Zeige > in view of Gefüge der Sage, showing not exclusively/decisively property of human activity: Das Sichzeigen kennzeichnet als Erscheinen das An- und Abwesen des Anwesenden jeglicher Art und Stufe [presence still magnetizes presence/absence: self-showing marks the appearance of every kind/rank of presence/absence of all that is present] > even when man accomplishes showing, showing preceded by an indiction that it can be shown [beyond human] > must think of human saying like this to give adequate definition des Wesenden in all speaking

HDG.WL.content: even w/out organs, language speaks (Sprache spricht) > language speaks by saying, i.e. showing > this is how language speaks: language as showing, reaches into all regions of presences (Anwesens), summoning what is present (Anwesendes) to appear & fade > what language says (Sagen) wells up (entquillt) from what has been said and the still remaining unsaid Sage, which pervades (durchzieht) the Aufriss des Sprachwesens

motif.name: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE
motif.title: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE

HDG.WL.linkedContent: even w/out organs, language speaks (Sprache spricht) > language speaks by saying, i.e. showing > this is how language speaks: language as showing, reaches into all regions of presences (Anwesens), summoning what is present (Anwesendes) to appear & fade > what language says (Sagen) wells up (entquillt) from what has been said and the still remaining unsaid Sage, which pervades (durchzieht) the Aufriss des Sprachwesens

HDG.WL.content: a way (Weg): allows us to reach something (lässt gelangen) [arrival] > peculiarity (Eigentümliche) of language conceals itself > that we are allowed to listen, we belong to language, this belonging contains actual presence (eigentlich Wesende) of way to language [proximity to facticity of language] > essence of Saying will only make itself manifest (bekunden) if we attend (achten) w/ great instancy to what the foregoing Erläuterung has offered

motif.name: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE
motif.title: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE

HDG.WL.linkedContent: a way (Weg): allows us to reach something (lässt gelangen) [arrival] > peculiarity (Eigentümliche) of language conceals itself > that we are allowed to listen, we belong to language, this belonging contains actual presence (eigentlich Wesende) of way to language [proximity to facticity of language] > essence of Saying will only make itself manifest (bekunden) if we attend (achten) w/ great instancy to what the foregoing Erläuterung has offered

HDG.WL.content: [method of arrival, in the instant?] we need a plain, sudden, unforgettable thus forever new look (Blick) into something we don’t even try to know > the quick and stirring regsames Erregende) of Saying: earliest/most ancient at once, region of all places, first break of dawn for all that is present/absent, that which makes the cycle of day/night possible: Das Regende im Zeigen der Sage ist das Eignen ——Eignen (Owning) that moves Saying as Showing is Ereignis, yields (er-gibt) opening of the clearing, in which present beings can persist (anwähren) & absent beings can depart, while keeping (behalten) their persistence (Währen) in withdrawal (im Entzug) [cf. erasure of trace] > das Ereignende [what is yielding] ist das Ereignis selbst—nothing else > Ereignis can’t be represented as occurrence (Vorkommnis) or happening (Geschehen), “can only be experienced as abiding gift yielded (Gewährende) by saying” > Ereignis is not the result of something, but the giving yield (Er-gebnis), whose giving along gives us Es gibt, to which even Being needs to come [so to come] into its own as presence (um als Anwesen in sein Eigenes zu gelangen)

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.WL.content: Humboldt: inner illumination could impart such a different form to language, it would become totally other (ganz anderen) and new [presence worthy of the name?], an old shell (Gehäuse) w/ a new meaning

HDG.EC.content: in waiting we let things into where we ourselves belong, in rest (i.e. in return to themselves) > things, once returning as such, bring their own presence (Gegenwart) from themselves toward (entgegen) us, they fill out the emptiness that seems to gape around us as we wait > by not waiting on this restful repose, by hastening toward progress, humans become pacesetter (Schrittmacher) of devastation
HDG.EC.linkedContent: in waiting we let things into where we ourselves belong, in rest (i.e. in return to themselves) > things, once returning as such, bring their own presence (Gegenwart) from themselves toward (entgegen) us, they fill out the emptiness that seems to gape around us as we wait > by not waiting on this restful repose, by hastening toward progress, humans become pacesetter (Schrittmacher) of devastation

HDG.OHF.content: [method, Heidegger now explains how the analysis will bring factical Dasein into view, e.g. uncover curiosity in its categorial-ontological character, see Dasein in presence of existentials showing up (herausspringenden)]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: [method, Heidegger now explains how the analysis will bring factical Dasein into view, e.g. uncover curiosity in its categorial-ontological character, see Dasein in presence of existentials showing up (herausspringenden)]
